intro: Oxybaphus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy oxybaphus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, sandy soils. Oxybaphus hirsutus is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
